Buffalo.WMSX:
WMSX is an FM radio station licensed to and broadcasting from Buffalo, New York on 96.1 FM, which has a hot-leaning adult contemporary format. The station is owned by Townsquare Media and has studios based in the Rand Building downtown; the station's transmitter is located on the roof of the same building.
The station signed on as WBNY-FM in 1966 as a sister station to an AM station on 1400 which also held the WBNY calls (unrelated to today's WBNY, a college radio station at 91.3 FM); it adopted the call letters of WJYE on February 1, 1979.
